description: Construction of a detached bungalow to the rear of No. 25 Bennetts Avenue including associated amenity space, cycle storage and refuse storage provision (following demolition of outbuildings); extensions to existing dwellinghouse including single storey rear extension (following demolition of single storey rear extension); alteration of roof from hip to gable end; rear roof extension; and installation of two roof lights to front roof slope
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason:  In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) Block/Site Plan ref. 1:500, received 14 May 2018; Location Plan ref. A 01-Rev.1, received 09 July 2018; Existing Block Plan of Site ref. A 02, received 14 May 2018; Proposed Block Plan of Site ref. A 03-Rev.1, received 09 July 2018; Existing Ground Floor Plan & Existing First Floor Plan ref. A 04, received 14 May 2018; Proposed Ground Floor Plan & Proposed First Floor Plan ref. A 05, received 14 May 2018; Proposed Loft Conversion ref. A 06-Rev. 1, received 09 July 2018; Loft Conversion ref. A 07-Rev. 1, received 09 July 2018; Proposed Garden House Ground plan, A & B Elevation / Proposed Pitched Roof for Garden House/ Proposed Pipeline Service ref. A 08-Rev. 1, received 09 July 2018; Existing Rear Elevation & Existing Front Elevation Proposed Rear Elevation & Proposed Front Elevation ref. A 09-Rev. 1, received 09 July 2018; Existing Side Elevation & Section A-A ref. A10 Rev.1, received 09 July 2018; Proposed Side Elevation & Section A-A ref. A11-Rev.1, received 09 July 2018; Existing Street Scene Elevation Drawing/ Image from Middleton 2 & 4 ref. A12, received 12 July 2018; Proposed Street Scene Elevation Drawing / Image from Middleton 2 & 4 ref. A13, received 12 July 2018.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans, details of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the detached dwelling hereby approved shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced (except site clearance and demolition). The development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Ensure refuse and recycling storage are provided and brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policy 5.16 of the London Plan (2016).

| A minimum of one cycle parking spaces shall be provided for the new dwelling and located in a secure undercover lockable compound, prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter.

Reason:  In the interests of highway and pedestrian safety in accordance with policies 1.1 f of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any subsequent amendment or new Order), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the existing dwelling on the site.

Reason:  To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | No part of the roof of the extensions shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016), and policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).
| The installation in each dwelling of an ultra-low NOx boiler with maximum NOx emissions of under 0.030 g/kWh shall be completed prior to first occupation and thereafter permanently retained.
Reason: In order to comply with Ealing Council's commitment to being an Air Quality Exemplar Borough and policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016).

| Building envelope insulation for the approved residential building, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, shall be installed to achieve the internal noise targets adopted by the Local Planning Authority:
a.	Bedrooms (23.00-07.00 hrs) 30 dB LAeq and 45 dB Lmax (fast).
b.	Living rooms (07.00-23.00 hrs) 35 dB LAeq.
c.	Kitchens, bathrooms, WC and utility rooms (07.00-23.00 hrs) 45 dB LAeq.
The sound insulation measures shall be installed and fully completed prior to first occupation of each dwelling and maintained thereafter.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013) and SPG10: Noise and Vibration.

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D, E or F of Part 1 and Class A of Part 2 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 and/or any subsequent amendment, no alterations or extensions to the detached dwelling hereby approved, outbuildings within their curtilage or gate, fence, wall or other means of enclosure around the curtilage shall be erected without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of the residents of adjoining properties and the dwelling hereby approved and the visual appearance of the building, in accordance with policies 7A, 7.4 and 7B of the Development Management, Development Plan Document (2013); adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (2012); policies 3.5, 7.4, 7.5, and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016); and National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Details of hard and soft landscaping and boundary treatment shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013) and SPG10: Noise and Vibration.
